text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to explain the applicable law test: the counterclaim must be grounded in obligations applicable to the investor under the applicable law (domestic law and/or international law as determined by the treaty\u2019s applicable-law clause and the procedural rules). The candidate answer addresses this in Section 3, 'The applicable-law component,' explaining that the state must anchor its claim in a treaty provision (like an umbrella clause incorporating domestic law) or that the breach of domestic law must also constitute a breach of the BIT's substantive obligations. It explicitly discusses how domestic law is incorporated or relied upon, which satisfies the requirement to explain the applicable law test.", "criterion_id": "47ddb755-e7f6-4ead-a8aa-80db8a87a3b9"}
